title: Understanding Spontaneity
text: To determine if a reaction is spontaneous, we need to consider the Gibbs free energy change (ΔG). A negative ΔG indicates a spontaneous reaction.

title: Gibbs Free Energy Equation
text: The Gibbs free energy change (ΔG) can be calculated using the equation: $$ΔG=\Delta H-T \Delta S$$. Here, T is the temperature in Kelvin.

title: Converting Units
text: Ensure that the units for ΔH and ΔS are consistent. Convert ΔS from $$\frac{J}{K}$$ to $$\frac{kJ}{K}$$ by dividing by $$1000$$.

title: Temperature Conversion
text: Convert the temperature from Celsius to Kelvin by adding $$273.15$$ to the Celsius temperature.

title: Calculate ΔG
text: Substitute the values into the equation $$ΔG=\Delta H-T \Delta S$$ to find the Gibbs free energy change. Check if ΔG is positive or negative to determine spontaneity.
